g.text: I am an employee in a company with a @microsoft.com email address.
What is the simplest way to spin up a Slack API client?
Searching for Slack API user token documentation...
Searching for enterprise Slack app setup...
Fetching official Slack Web API documentation page...
Simplest Approach: Create a Slack App with User Token Scopes
For a personal Slack client that can read/write all channels...
I went to /apps site and clicked Create an app, then it shows me this [screenshot]
I see you're on the "Your Apps" page. Click the green "Create an App" button...
Who will have access to this app? I'd like to lock it down to just me...
Only YOU - when you create and install a personal Slack app, it's private by default...
• systemTokens (11,300) is constant across ALL LLM calls in the conversation
• userTokens is constant within a turn but varies between turns
• toolResultTokens grows with each tool call (0 → 4.5K → 10.2K → 37.7K)
• Tool results persist in context across turns (Turn 2 & 3 inherit 37.7K)
• Tokenizer ratio varies (0.43 to 0.91) — estimate ≠ actual tokens billed
• No truncation occurred: peak usage ~51K < 128K maxTokenWindow
